intro: Codonoboea bakoensis var. tenuior, commonly known as the slender codonoboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
